Background.data_info: For those with amount of rainfall in a region being high (A=1), the probability of water level in a local reservoir being high (B=1) is 0.6747. The probability of amount of rainfall in a region being low (A=0) and water level in a local reservoir being low (B=0) is 0.1859. The probability of amount of rainfall in a region being high (A=1) and water level in a local reservoir being high (B=1) is 0.3900.

Questions.Instruction: Consider the probability of sufficiency (PS) of amount of rainfall in a region on water level in a local reservoir.
Questions.Question: Given that amount of rainfall in a region was low and water level in a local reservoir was low, what is the upper bound of the probability that water level in a local reservoir would have been high if the amount of rainfall in a region had been high?

Reason.Step 1:
Calculate P(B=1|do(A=1))
P(B=1|do(A=1))=P(B=1|A=1)=0.6747
